title: P22 Civilite preview
content:

A suite of 25 fonts available soon. Includes 6 Pro styles.
author: kegler

comments.content:
Nice! I found this style online as a free font about 12 years ago, and chose it for my Costume Goddess business. I re-designed the "T" though (below) 'cause it looked more like a "C".

I just bought this new one and what a pleasure to use! Now I have a complete character set. I can especially see the difference when I outline it. Very smooth, about 10 times fewer anchor points.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202224054im_/http:/typophile.com/files/book#3cover_72_6625.jpg)
By the way, sorry about the free (bootlegged?) font use for my commercial materials, but at that time I knew nothing about fonts or how to acquire them. I had just purchased my first computer.

_I just bought this new one and what a pleasure to use! Now I have a complete character set._

Where did you buy this new one?
On MyFonts...is it not your version?
was curious because it isn't actually released yet. Just wondering if someone jumped the gun. :^)
It’s a pretty solid revival—I’ll probably pick up the specimen book just to stare. What inspired you to do a Civilite revival?

It must be live. I got the P22 email announcement. Congrats, Rich!!!

ChrisL

_What inspired you to do a Civilite revival?_

Means, motive and opportunity.  
...Or just indulgence. Being in the midst of a recession, spending a lot of time on a rather esoteric style of limited use is probably the last thing we should be doing. But sometimes you just have to do things.
